citation.article-title: Succiniclasticum ruminis gen. nov., sp. nov., a ruminal bacterium converting succinate to propionate as the sole energy-yielding mechanism.

p.s: Succiniclasticum (Suc.cin.i.clas'ti.cum. L. adj. succinicus, succinic; Gr. v. klao, to break; L. adj. clasticum, breaking; L. neut. n. Succiniclasticum, breaking or splitting succinic acid)
The genus is characterized by not being able to ferment carbohydrates, amino acids, or mono-, di-, and tricarboxylic acids other than succinate, which is converted to propionate.
Members of this genus are not proteolytic and do not produce catalase or urease or reduce nitrate.
